title: Group Project fieldtrip to Tahoe-Central Sierra region
description: A short description of the post.
contents:
This December, my Group Project team and I had the opportunity to visit the our Group Project study region, the Tahoe-Central Sierra. We meet our client, Blue Forest Conservation in Bullardâ€™s Bar Reservoir and toured a number of sites in the Yuba Watershed to discuss various project sites, wildfire impacts, restoration goals and the resevoir itself!
Bullards Bar ReservoirAfter discussing sedimentation and woody debris impacts to reservoir operations, we toured the Pendola Fire burn area where active restoration was taking place to reduce erosion and sediment into the reservoir.
Pendola Fire siteOn our second day, we meet with the general manager at Sierra Pacific Industries, where we toured their lumber mill and cogeneration facility. We learned about operations, discussed the impacts of wildfire risk to operations and toured the facility.
Sierra Pacific Industries tour

title: JMT
description: A short description of the post.
contents: A few summers ago, I had the opportunity to hike the John Muir Trail from south to north. It turned out to be a decent snow year, which complicated our itinerary a bit.

title: Welcome
description: This is a space where I'll yell into the ethersphere...
contents: Welcome to my blog. I will provide my musings on water, climate and management decisions on a relatively frequent basis.
